comments.raw_text:
This bug is for disabling most of the browsertime tests running on mozilla-central and autoland. They are only there as "smoke-tests" and the data isn't (and shouldn't be) ingested anywhere.

Here's autoland: https://treeherder.mozilla.org/#/jobs?repo=autoland&tier=1%2C2%2C3&searchStr=browsertime&revision=ff07fdc7c70e1c0a45e10535e26e5dec7958a7a0

Here's mozilla-central: https://treeherder.mozilla.org/#/jobs?repo=mozilla-central&tier=1%2C2%2C3&searchStr=browsertime

I'm thinking that we should disable all the autoland tests since they aren't being used for anything and run the benchmarks on mozilla-central if we want to. That said, on mozilla-central, I think we should restrict all the tests to linux64-shippable and disable all other platforms (on desktop).
comments.text:
This bug is for disabling most of the browsertime tests running on mozilla-central and autoland. They are only there as "smoke-tests" and the data isn't (and shouldn't be) ingested anywhere.

Here's autoland: https://treeherder.mozilla.org/#/jobs?repo=autoland&tier=1%2C2%2C3&searchStr=browsertime&revision=ff07fdc7c70e1c0a45e10535e26e5dec7958a7a0

Here's mozilla-central: https://treeherder.mozilla.org/#/jobs?repo=mozilla-central&tier=1%2C2%2C3&searchStr=browsertime

I'm thinking that we should disable all the autoland tests since they aren't being used for anything and run the benchmarks on mozilla-central if we want to. That said, on mozilla-central, I think we should restrict all the tests to linux64-shippable and disable all other platforms (on desktop).
comments.author: gmierz2@outlook.com
comments.creator: gmierz2@outlook.com
gmierz2@outlook.com
comments.author: gmierz2@outlook.com
comments.text:
Created attachment 9150573
Bug 1639374 - Disable majority of browsertime desktops. r?#perftest


This patch disables the majority of browsertime desktop tests. First, we disable all of the tests on autoland so no more browsertime tests run there. These benchmark tests that were running there will be enabled on mozilla-central along with the rest of the tests. Finally, all browsertime tests will be further restricted to running on the linx64-shippable platform.
